member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema
member.summary: An object representing a JSON schema. Each property of a JSON schema ($schema, title, and description are metadata, not properties) is also a JSON schema, so the class is recursive.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Ref
member.summary: A reference to the location in the parent schema where this schema's definition can be found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Items
member.summary: The JSONSchema that will be applied to the elements of this schema, assuming this schema is an array schema type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Format
member.summary: The format of the value that matches this schema. This only applies to string values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Description
member.summary: The description metadata that describes this schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.JsonType
member.summary: The type metadata of this schema that describes what type matching JSON values must be. For example, this value will be either "object", "string", "array", "integer", "number", or "boolean".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.ResourceType
member.summary: Get the resource type of this JsonSchema. If this JsonSchema defines an Azure Resource, then this value will be found in definition.properties.type.enum[0]. If this JsonSchema does not define an Azure Resource, then this will return null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.AdditionalProperties
member.summary: The schema that matches additional properties that have not been specified in the Properties dictionary.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Enum
member.summary: An enumeration of values that will match this JSON schema. Any value not in this enumeration will not match this schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Properties
member.summary: The schemas that describe the properties of a matching JSON value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Required
member.summary: The names of the properties that are required for a matching JSON value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Resources
member.summary: The child resources that are allowed for this JsonSchema.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.AddEnum(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Add a new value (or values) to this JsonSchema's enum list. This JsonSchema (with the new value(s)) is then returned so that additional changes can be chained together.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.AddProperty(System.String,Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema)
member.summary: Add a new property to this JsonSchema, and then return this JsonSchema so that additional changes can be chained together.
member.param: The name of the property to add.
The JsonSchema definition of the property to add.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.AddProperty(System.String,Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a new property to this JsonSchema, and then return this JsonSchema so that additional changes can be chained together.
member.param: The name of the property to add.
The JsonSchema definition of the property to add.
Whether this property is required or not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.AddRequired(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Add the provided required property names to this JSON schema's list of required property names.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.AddResource(Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema)
member.summary: Add a child resource schema to this JsonSchema.
member.param: The child resource schema to add to this JsonSchema.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema.Clone
member.summary: Create a new JsonSchema that is an exact copy of this one.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema
member.summary: An object representing an Azure Resource Schema. It is important to note that an Azure resource schema is actually not a valid JSON schema by itself. It is part of the deploymentTemplate.json schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.Id
member.summary: The id metadata that uniquely identifies this schema. Usually this will be the URL to the permanent location of this schema in schema.management.azure.com/schemas/.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.Schema
member.summary: The JSON schema metadata url that points to the schema that can be used to validate this schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.Title
member.summary: The title metadata for this schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.Description
member.summary: The description metadata that describes this schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.ResourceDefinitions
member.summary: The named JSON schemas that define the resources of this resource schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.Definitions
member.summary: The named reusable JSON schemas that the resource definitions reference. These definitions can also reference each other or themselves.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.GetResourceDefinitionByResourceType(System.String)
member.summary: Search this ResourceSchema for a resource definition that has the provided type.
member.param: The resource type to look for in this ResourceSchema.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.AddResourceDefinition(System.String,Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema)
member.summary: Add the provided resource definition JSON schema to this resourceh schema.
member.param: The name of the resource definition.
The JSON schema that describes the resource.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchema.AddDefinition(System.String,Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.JsonSchema)
member.summary: Add the provided definition JSON schema to this resourceh schema.
member.param: The name of the resource definition.
The JSON schema that describes the resource.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchemaParser
member.summary: The ResourceSchemaParser class is responsible for converting a ServiceClient object into a ResourceSchemaModel.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchemaParser.Parse(Microsoft.Rest.Generator.ClientModel.ServiceClient)
member.summary: Parse a ResourceSchemaModel from the provided ServiceClient.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchemaParser.IsCreateResourceMethod(Microsoft.Rest.Generator.ClientModel.Method)
member.summary: Determine whether the provided method object represents an Azure REST API that would create an Azure resource.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Generator.AzureResourceSchema.ResourceSchemaParser.GetResourceTypes(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{Microsoft.Rest.Generator.ClientModel.Parameter})
member.summary: Get the resource type from the provided resourceProvider and the portion of the method URL path that comes after the resourceProvider section.
